module.p: os cionn above, beyond, in charge of, over, overhead is a prepositional compound, with head os over, above and complement cionn head [old dative form].

section.p:
Examples –
os cionn na mara
above the sea, above sea level td. 463
os mo chionn; os ar cionn
overhead, over my head; over our heads td. 135
Aig aon àm bha e os cionn na sgoile seo.
At one time he was in charge of this school. td. 463
Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General to [who will] oversee the Society’s work. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’

Examples –
beagan os cionn
a cut above td. 135

Examples –
Aig aon àm bha e os cionn na sgoile seo.
At one time he was in charge of this school. td. 463
Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General to [who will] oversee the Society’s work. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’
